title: Can Blits at least have some risk for his Q?
body:
Once blits grabs you, you're pretty much dead. Would it be too much to ask for blits grab to have a shorter range? 

I mean, he does have a knock up and silence? and a tanky passive?

I think he should have to get closer in order to land his grab so my team could actually help if i get caught.

replies.body:
He's really annoying, but he's such a one trick pony since his whole kit revolves around him being able to grab you.

Just stand behind minions, ward if he roams lanes, idk it's not that hard. 

I used to really hate Blitz and swore up and down he was up OP but nah he's not. Just one of those things.
it's called, grabbing the wrong person

> [{quoted}](name=ZephyrDrake,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BfNzX42e,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-03T04:36:05.496+0000)
>
> it's called, grabbing the wrong person

Regardless of my or anyone else's opinion of Blitzcrank:

 "Hope the guy playing him is incompetent." is not a valid example of either _Champion Weaknesses_ or counterplay.

To be fair, a tank can intercept the Q. It's a bit more lethal than body-blocking most skillshots, since being grabbed can place you into a sweet engaging position. Sejuani, for instance, could benefit from using her Q to block a Blitz Q, then retaliating with her ult and getting everyone behind Blitzcrank.

Yes, a person less vulnerable to it, like a tank, can stand in front of someone more vulnerable and all that.
But that doesn't matter.

It's not valid; it's a Red Herring.  This excuse does not discuss the questions being raised by this discussion so it is not a valid point of discussion whether it's about this mechanic, a different mechanic, a champion's current strength and performance, or anything else.

_"it's called, 'that player can misplay'. So it's fine."_ is an excuse that can be applied to literally everything in this game.

>"it's called, 'that player can misplay'. So it's fine."

But I didn't say that.

I specifically gave an instance where a player can outplay Blitzcrank. A tank using their ability to intercept another ability to put them in a favorable position to initiate an engage is different than Blitzcrank accidentally grabbing the tank. A little more involved than just standing in front of them, which *would* be a misplay on Blitzcrank's part but that's not the specific scenario I mentioned in any form. Sejuani using her Q to intercept a game-changing skillshot is not "[standing] in front of someone more vulnerable and all that." That would specifically be an outplay on *Sejuani's* part, not a misplay on Blitzcrank's. 

Positioning is a part of the game, and it's part of counterplay. It's why we don't have ADC's in the frontline of a teamfight, and tanks behind them. If a team properly positions themselves, they can outplay enemy mechanics that rely on aim and timing (like a Blitzcrank Q).
